name: August Virtual AppSec Days Summer of Security

metadata.description: Ethical Hacking is quite effective for organizations to find out the vulnerabilities of information systems and fix the weaknesses before malicious hackers or adversaries may exploit their systems. This training session is formed to make the students aware of various hacking tools being used in the industry by cybersecurity professionals. Presented by Muhammad Aamir

During this training you will learn how to work from zero to hero with OWASP ZAP, write your own malicious scripts to run your arbitrary codes and security tests on your target.
This training will focus on deep understanding about one of the best penetration test tools “OWASP ZAP” and techniques to write our own scripts in it. Presented by Ali Abdollahi

products.name: Hacking Android & IoT apps by Example

metadata.description: All action, no fluff, improve your security analysis workflow and immediately apply these gained skills in your workplace, packed with exercises, extra mile challenges and CTF, self-paced and suitable for all skill levels, with continued education via unlimited email support and lifetime access to training portal with step-by-step video recordings. Presented by Abraham Aranguren

products.name: Training: Ethical Hacking - security seen from an offensive perspective

metadata.description:
Modules:
• Penetration testing overview
• Various types of footprinting tools and countermeasures
• Network scanning techniques and scanning countermeasures
• Enumeration techniques and enumeration countermeasures
• System hacking methodology
• Packet sniffing techniques, session hijacking
Level: beginner-intermediate
Presented by Gabriel Avramescu

products.name: Training: Fuzzing: An effective alternative to code review and penetration testing

metadata.description: This course aims to provide a strong base to use fuzzing as an effective alternative to discover vulnerabilities. Attendees will gain usable knowledge on fuzzing, learn to build an effective wordlist, use Python to build application specific fuzzing tools and see use cases to discover OWASP TOP 10 vulnerabilities using fuzzing. Presented by Alper Basaran

products.name: Training: DevSecOps with GitHub Actions and Azure

metadata.description: DevSecOps, as defined for this course, is performing application security activities, in a DevOps environment. This course will kick off with brief theory about AppSec and DevOps, and then spend the rest of the day locking down your GitHub repo, creating a CI/CD using GitHub Actions, adding security tools to your CI/CD, and finding security bugs. Presented by Tanya Janca

The session would be for Beginners and would cover Common occuring bugs in Web APIs , Some Hands On Training with the online Labs, and some Prevention Techniques for the most common attacks and Some case studies. Presented by Tushar Kulkarni

Containers are in popular use as the distribution vehicle for cloud-native application services. In this workshop, you'll learn about the fundamental aspects of security that associate with the platform components. Presented by Mehul Patel
